definition: to interrupt (a radio or TV program) with a commercial insert, breaking news etc/to put a call on hold
to insert/stick in/pierce/to take part in/to interfere/to interpose
to sow/to scatter/to spread/to broadcast/Taiwan pr. [bo4]

sentences.english: Because the TV stations need to make money from commercials between the programs.
sentences.chinese: 因爲電視臺需要從節目中間插播的廣告賺取利潤。

sentences.english: We interrupt our programmes for a newsflash.
sentences.chinese: 我們中斷節目，插播一條重要新聞。

sentences.english: The station cuts to a commercial.
sentences.chinese: 電視臺插播了商業廣告節目。

sentences.english: They larded many commercials into a ten-minute period before the soap opera.
sentences.chinese: 他們在肥皂劇前的十分鐘內插播了許多商業廣告。

sentences.english: Please don't jam progammes into advertisements.
sentences.chinese: 請不要在廣告中插播春晚。

sentences.english: Paramount News brings you special  coverage of Princess Ann's visit to London.
sentences.chinese: 派氏新聞社，插播一新聞快報，安公主刻正拜訪倫敦。

sentences.english: They see a breaking news report about Banerjee's assassination.
sentences.chinese: 他們看到了臨時插播的有關內維被暗殺的報道。

sentences.english: It is learned that the 2014 CCTV Spring Festival Gala may remain "Zero Advertising".
sentences.chinese: 據說今年春晚將仍保持零廣告插播形式。

sentences.english: American TV has a large number of commercial breaks.
sentences.chinese: 美國電視中充斥着大量的插播廣告。

sentences.english: And to illustrate, I want to show you a quick video.
sentences.chinese: 爲了說明這一點，我會插播一段錄像。

sentences.english: They were locking the vestibules and putting the cars in order for a long run.
sentences.chinese: 我們要在以後三週時間裏插播出一系列電視廣告節目。

sentences.english: The majority of products marketed during children’s programming are foods.
sentences.chinese: 兒童節目中插播的大多數產品廣告都是食品商的。

sentences.english: What is more, consumers fell annoyed to be interrupted when they are watching TV plays.
sentences.chinese: 更有甚者，消費者覺得看電視劇時插播廣告讓人心煩。

definition: to return to the topic (idiom)/to get back to the main point
editor or creator of online content (diminutive term, often used to refer to oneself: I, me, this writer)
to broadcast over a network/(radio or TV) hookup/simulcast
